subject: News Summary
body:
CBSNews.com






May 8, 2007


                              		
                              		
                              	  Home | U.S. | World | Politics | SciTech | Health | Entertainment | Business | Opinion | Sports | Blogs | Interactives | Video



                              	
                              	  The Early Show | CBS Evening News | 48 Hours | 60 Minutes | The Saturday Early Show | CBS Sunday Morning | Face The Nation






TOP STORIESU.S.: Fort Dix Plot Aimed At Soldiers
Six men described by federal prosecutors as "Islamic militants" were arrested on charges they plotted to attack the Fort Dix
                        Army base and "kill as many soldiers as possible." Three of the men were in the U.S. illegaly, authorities said. More...
• Midwest Braces For Major Flooding• Historic N. Ireland Deal Becomes Reality• Rally Clash Leads To LAPD Shakeup
                     					| WatchU.S.Search Resumes For Kansas Tornado Victims
The death toll from a tornado that nearly obliterated the farming town of Greensburg, Kansas, climbed to nine as cadaver-sniffing
                        dogs scoured rubble alongside residents who were allowed to return to the rubble of their homes. More...Watch: Recovery Under Way In Kansas
• U.S.: Fort Dix Plot Aimed At Soldiers• 5 Dead In Navy Helicopter Crash• Rally Clash Leads To LAPD Shakeup
                     					| Watch• More StoriesWorldHistoric N. Ireland Deal Becomes Reality
Leaders of Northern Ireland's key Catholic and Protestant parties have been sworn in as ministers in a new power-sharing government,
                        making reality out of a concept born nine years ago. Officials spoke of a real opportunity for lasting peace. More...
• Blast Kills 16 In Shiite Holy City
                     					| Watch• Archaeologist Finds King Herod's Tomb• Rebels: 3 Nigeria Oil Pipelines Destroyed
                     					| Watch• More StoriesPoliticsAn Exit Strategy For Wolfowitz?
A deal may be in the works to end Paul D. Wolfowitz's troubled tenure as president of the World Bank. And Washington goes
                        "gaga" over Queen Elizabeth II. Joel Roberts has the highlights of the day's headlines. More...Watch: Royal Wrap-Up
• A White House Dinner Fit For A Queen
                     					| Watch• Sen. Lott Joins Republican War Weary• Obama: U.S. Needs More Fuel-Efficient Cars
                     					| Watch• More StoriesHealthRating The Best Diets
Consumer Reports surveyed diet plans to find out which was the most effective and easiest to follow. The magazine also talked
                        to people who have lost a lot of weight, to learn about their strategies. More...Watch: Which Diets Really Work?
• TV Hurts Kids Of All Ages, Studies Say
                     					| Watch• "Cocaine" Pulled From Shelves Nationwide• Study: Moms Of Autistic Kids Cope Well• More StoriesSciTechArchaeologist Finds King Herod's Tomb
An Israeli archaeologist has found the tomb of King Herod, the legendary builder of ancient Jerusalem and the Holy Land, Hebrew
                        University said. More...
• Astronomers Spot Biggest Supernova Ever• Obama: U.S. Needs More Fuel-Efficient Cars
                     					| Watch• Are You A High Tech "Omnivore"?• More StoriesBusinessAuto Loan Rates Higher For Blacks
Blacks have been charged higher auto loan rates than other auto buyers, federal research says. But the gap in loan rates could
                        narrow, and possibly disappear, as the result of recently concluded lawsuits. More...
• Gas Prices Keep Climbing
                     					| Watch• Alcoa Bids For Canadian Aluminum Rival• Dow Jones Bid Puts CNBC On The Defensive• More StoriesEntertainment"Free Paris Hilton!" Petition Begs
A friend of Paris Hilton has created an online petition that asks California Gov. Arnold Schwarzenegger to pardon the heiress
                        from jail because "she didn't hurt or kill anyone, and she has learned her lesson." More...Watch: Paris' Jail Term: Not 'Simple'
• George Michael Pleads Guilty• Judge Suspends Hasselhoff's Visitation
                     					| Watch• Woman Says Phil Spector Turned "Demonic"
                     					| Watch• More StoriesOpinionSarkozy Won't Be Bush's French Poodle
Nicolas Sarkozy has been portrayed as a neo-conservative who would be President Bush's French poodle. But Sarkozy's criticisms
                        of the U.S. in his acceptance speech signal an honest friendship, says the Nation. More...Watch: France Elects Next President
• Turning Over A Nouveau Leaf
                     					| Watch• What War? We Have Sanjaya!• Trying To Make Sense Of The Papers• More StoriesCBS NEWS BROADCASTSThe Early Show: Susan Koeppen: Rating The Best Diets
Consumer Reports surveyed diet plans to find out which was the most effective and easiest to follow. The magazine also talked
                        to people who have lost a lot of weight, to learn about their strategies. More...Watch: Which Diets Really Work?

Taiwan Lawmakers BrawlA fistfight broke out in the Taiwanese legislature in Taipei during a debate over an electoral reform bill, injuring a female
                                    legislator. WCBS' Chris Wragge reports.
